thread.title: Police: Woman charged with DUI after driving over 100 mph in Aurora
thread.title_full: Police: Woman charged with DUI after driving over 100 mph in Aurora

author: Hannah Leone
title: Police: Woman charged with DUI after driving over 100 mph in Aurora
text:
Police: Woman charged with DUI after driving over 100 mph in Aurora Police: Woman charged with DUI after driving over 100 mph in Aurora Aurora Police Department / Handout Yadira Rodriguez (Aurora Police Department / Handout) Hannah Leone Aurora Beacon-News Privacy Policy 
A 28-year-old Oswego woman was charged with drunk driving while drag racing over 100 miles per hour last weekend in Aurora, police said. 
Yadira Rodriguez, 28, of the 100 block of Locust Street, Oswego, was arrested on the 900 block of Fulton Street and charged Saturday with driving under the influence of alcohol and drag racing, along with another traffic violation, according to Aurora police reports. 
An Aurora police officer in a fully-marked squad car saw Rodriguez and a 28-year-old male passenger were street racing with another vehicle in the area of New York Street and Loucks, police spokesman Dan Ferrelli said in an email. The officer estimated the cars were traveling in excess of 100 miles per hour, Ferrelli said. 
When he turned on his lights and siren, one of the cars stopped for the red light at Ohio while Rodriguez continued through the light, eventually pulling over near Fulton and Smith, Ferrelli said. 
Upon investigation, police said that Rodriguez was showing signs of impairment for which she was ultimately charged, Ferrelli said. 
Information on the other car was not contained in the police report, Ferrelli said. 
Rodriguez was previously found guilty of drunken driving in 2013 in Kendall County, records show. 
She was booked at 2:36 a.m. Saturday and given a 10 percent bond set at $300, then released later that morning, according to Aurora police reports.
